185988907.review: One of the most unique game experiences I've ever had. I was able to 100% it in ~8 hours and felt like I definitely got my money's worth in every minute of it. This is actual art and the acting makes your really feel like Senua is a real person. The gameplay is satisfying, but the combat is fairly simple with a few interesting big fights and puzzles that make you try to see and think about the world differently. As a whole this is a beautiful and intense story with incredible audio and visual elements. It's incredibly immersive with no HUD or really anything that isn't part of the game's world. Horror elements that aren't cheap scare tactics but a legitimately harrowing experience that accurately portrays psychosis from the perspective of someone suffering. Ninja Theory did something amazing with this one. I highly recommend this game.

185878056.review:
É indescritível a capacidade que esse jogo teve de transmitir a mim um sentimento de desespero, de angústia, de ansiedade...

De uma forma resumida, Hellblade é um jogo que traz uma narrativa imersiva, onde acompanhamos Senua enfrentando seus próprios "demônios" internos na busca de um objetivo bastante nobre, enquanto isso, o jogo nos envolve em histórias sobre os mitos e lendas nórdicos, o que nos ambienta melhor nesse universo.

A progressão do jogo nos coloca em meio a diversos puzzles, alternados com trechos de combate e história. 

Os puzzles são muito criativos (principalmente os trechos de Valravn e o Tower Shard), envolvem muitas brincadeiras de perspectiva, onde temos que nos posicionar no cenário para formar imagens específicas e liberar o caminho, além de atravessar "portais" que mudam a disposição do cenário para que possamos realizar as interações corretas nas salas.

O combate é bastante simples mas cumpre o que é necessário para o que o jogo pede, você pode bater (forte e fraco), esquivar, rolar, defletir os ataques e ativar um Foco pra que os inimigos fiquem mais lentos por um breve período, todas essas mecânicas funcionam muito bem.

Os gráficos são muito lindos (mesmo em configurações mais leves), trazendo um realismo que ajuda a gente a se sentir mais próximo do mundo em que ele é ambientado.

É um jogo que tem a duração que precisa ter para contar a história que quer contar, com muito capricho e carinho envolvido na produção.

Recomendadíssimo!

This is a unique piece of interactive art that explores complex themes of mental health and human resilience. The story, visual style, and sound work together to create a powerful atmosphere that immerses players in Senua's dark and poignant world.
Although the game has linear gameplay and is relatively short, its quality and attention to detail leave an unforgettable impression. Hellblade is a prime example of how video games can be more than just entertainment—they can be a medium for conveying profound and important narratives.
If you're looking for something unique and memorable, this game is an excellent choice.

185798651.review:
Це шикарний твір. Є він таким перш за все, тому що його компоненти, які вже є доволі якісними самі по собі, надзвичайно гармонійно поєднуються, тим самим доповнюючи та пояснюючи один одного. 

Для початку про зовнішню, або ж аудіовізуальну частину - вона тут добра. Саунд-дизайн дуже якісний, сидячи в навушниках ти відчуваєш ефект присутності(значну частину звуків, а особливо реплік записували на бінауральний мікрофон, і це дуже відчувається). По візуалу ж - дизайн персонажів та оточення гарний, багато красивих пейзажів, або ж доволі цікавих приміщень чи локацій. 

Щодо сюжетної компоненти - це насправді ядро і фундаментальна частина гри. Невеличкий вступ - історія ведеться від імені дівчини(сама вона з народу Піктів) із психозом, котра постійно страждала від власного батька, котра тривалий час жила в ізоляції, начебто через свою хворобу, котру звинуватили в появі чуми у місті і котра втратила коханого через набіг вікінгів, тут і починається історія гри. Аби повернути його із світу мертвих, вона вирушає до Геллхейму(царства мертвих) аби врятувати його душу. І протягом цієї історії гра робить одну, надзвичайно важливу річ, котра робить саму історію доволі унікальною - вона міняє акцент з доволі поширеного сприйняття людини у подібних випадках, мовляв "Сенуа є хворою через те що в неї є такі і такі симптоми" на "Сенуа є хворою і має ці симптоми перш за все через те, що вона пережила". Тобто іде пояснення рівня відповідальності суспільства за те, що люди з подібними вадами відчувають та переживають. Ну бо насправді у грі є 3 персонажі котрі добре ставляться до Сенуа: її матір та Друдх(вигнанець у лісі), котрі мають такі ж самі вади, і Ділліон, її коханий, чию голову вона й несе протягом всієї гри. І от нам демонструють наскільки наявність однієї людини, котра тебе не цурається, може бути важливою та життєдайною. 



І от на цьому етапі варто перейти до ігроладу, власне тої речі котра і робить відеоігри унікальними. Загалом тут є 3 основні активності: 

Бродити
Розв'язувати головоломки
Битися з ворогами
І от з одного боку в більшості випадків нема нічого аж надто складного, так інколи можна потупити пропустивши якийсь поворот чи двері.. Проте що робить гру особливою - це логічне пояснення і тісне поєднання ігроладу із сюжетом. Більшість головоломок тісно пов'язані з особливостями Сенуа. Однією з найпоширеніших є пошук схожих паттернів що повторюються в навколишній реальності, це можуть бути тіні, сплетіння балок і т.п. Те, що звичайна людина зазвичай і не зауважує. І от насправді хотів би виділити два елементи, котрі надзвичайно запам'яталися:

1.В певний момент ми втрачаємо свій меч. В результаті ми слухаємо легенду про меч, котрий може вбивати богів, аби його отримати необхідно пройти кілька випробувань, під час яких пояснюють як історію знайомства з Діліаном, коли ми постійно намагаємося досягти його силуету(женемося за спогадом по суті). І що тут відбувається насправді - чіпляння за спогад про Близьку людину, стає тим, що дозволяє пережити момент найбільшої зневіри, ну і певним чином стає тим що дозволяє бороти внутрішніх демонів. Окремо гарно виділяється момент, коли ми по суті бродимо в пітьмі, і єдиним нашим орієнтиром є якраз голос Діліана, який мало того що пояснює як заземлитися(умовно відчути свою присутність, те що є навколо), так ще й проводить крізь цей період темряви.

2.На одному етапі, буття в темряві/тіні без світла протягом певного моменту стає смертельним. Відповідно на початку, ти вчишся перебігати між статичними джерелами світла. І от тобі дають факел, ти спокійний, бо це означає що ти в безпеці. Але аби пройти рівень гра змушує тебе його позбутися кілька разів(самому пройти під водою, наприклад), і це якраз той випадок коли завдяки тому, що саме ти, як гравець, повинен це зробити, тобі стає неприємно. Ну бо це якраз вихід зі стану комфорту, це випадок коли щось може не вдатися. І одна штука - дивитися чи читати як хтось інший це робить, а інша - робити це у відеогрі. 

Поєднання її компонентів, те, що гра робилася з конкретною ідеєю, використання міфічного антуражу роблять її прям шикарною. Рекомендую словом.

Getting 100% was... interesting but a bit boring for me personally.

approximate amount of time to 100%: 5-15hours
Estimated achievement difficulty: 2/10
Minimum number of playthroughs needed: 1
Multiplayer achievements: No.
Missable achievements: Yes. The lorestones, a single achievement.
Point of no return: No. you have chapter select.
Grinding Achievements: No.
DLC-Only achievements: No.
Time-gated achievements: No.
Speed-run achievements: No.
RNG-achievements: No.
Does difficulty affect achievements: No choice.
First achievement unlock: When reaching the first gate, 10 minutes or so in.

Achievement wise the game is really straightforward, 13 are unmissable and on the main path, the last one is missable but easily track-able through the lit-up runes on the lorestones (chapter select helps but sometimes just walking back to that area is possible)

*What i got most from this game is a desire to go back to God of War (2016). It kept reminding me how good that game was.
*I see what they were going for with the movement speed but for me it mostly felt like a walking simulator. Long areas of doing nothing but walking, including slow as hell backtracking, with a run button that doesn't actually run, just walks a bit faster.
*The subtitles were also broken coming in and out at various times.
*Also highly recommend the FOV tool since the game doesn't feature any way of changing this.
*I hated the ending where **Spoilers** .....[spoiler] : you have to die to finish... [/spoiler] it's a bit odd, A good reason why games don't do this.

Even tho it didn't speak to me personally I will recommend it since it's a good experience and clearly a quality product.

185787195.review:
This is the kind of game that most studios aren't willing to put out for a multitude of reasons but I'm glad this was given the greenlight. The environment, motion capture, animations, character design and voice acting are all top notch. The story is engrossing and deals with topics that are rarely dealt with in games and does so very effectively through some clever use of color schemes to represent various feelings senua is going through. The idea of having an unreliable narrator placed in a medieval setting rife with myths and legends is something that I would love to see more games attempt as I think there is a lot that could be done there. I think this game ends on a good note as well and makes me curious as to where the sequel goes although the reviews for that make me a little hesitant. 

It is a walking simulator where your speed and mobility are limited so there are often there are points where you feel like you should be able to jump over or crawl through a section and the game doesn't let you and there are others where it does which is a tad immersion breaking but I'm not sure how much this has to do with the fact that I purposely strayed from the main path multiple times to search for the runestones. So, it may not be an issue for most as the game does a pretty good job of signposting where to go next to search for the next sign or door. 

The combat is fun but a little unwieldy, some of the smaller arenas in the game make this unwieldiness more bothersome as there is less space to maneuver around multiple enemies. There is one late stage upgrade that feels a little off anytime I use it and kind of ruins the flow of most encounters. The biggest issue I have though is that enemies routinely spawn behind you and attack quickly although there is an audio cue for this which makes it annoying but not gamebreaking and it might actually be purposeful to make you feel unsafe in every encounter. The bosses with the exception of fenrir feel very well designed and are extremely engaging.

I'd recommend this game for anyone who likes story driven games.

185779816.review:
What initially drew me to the game before even trying it were those shocked eyes filled with pain and vengeance, and the realistic emotions radiating from them. They made me love the game before playing it or even knowing what it was about, and I wanted to uncover the secrets it held.

Poor Senua the meaning for everything bad a person could go through. you will see how the psychological suffering that you might have read or heard about but never imagined, the experience feelings of loss, revenge, the death of principles and conscience, psychological turning points, and all the meanings of pain that force someone to transform into a completely different person, someone they no longer recognize. What you love becomes the source of your fear, and when you lose it, you completely shed that fear, becoming someone unrecognizable even to yourself.

This deep psychological aspect was what I started sensing during the first two hours of the game, where the excitement was at its peak. But after that, the flaws of the game began to surface.

The game can be described as an interactive movie. Walking between stages feels exhausting and slow, and the world is underdeveloped in terms of detail despite its small size. You feel like all you’re doing is walking and listening to annoying sounds throughout the game.

I really hated the voices of the two women who constantly talk to you. oh man they are so annoying! They are literally two women nagging in your ear the entire time, just when you want to focus on the gameplay and puzzles in each stage and immersing yourself in the atmosphere and events of the game. The idea is that these voices are supposed to represent spirits speaking to you, but in reality, it feels like two women backseat u and tell you every thing just to hate the game and hate your self. They are incredibly irritating, and I often felt exhausted because of them. 
What’s even funnier is that they recommend wearing headset, which only makes it worse haha, the devs really messed up implementing this concept, which was bad  idea from the start.

Another thing worth mentioning is the game’s other lengthy story about Viking mythology, which I appreciated. But the dumb thing about it is that this story is split into many parts—perhaps 30 segments—presented as wooden pillars "lorestones" you interact with throughout the game. To hear the full story, you need to interact with every single lorestone. 
Since many of these pillars are hidden, you’re bound to miss a lot of story details, making the remaining parts you find incomplete and meaningless. This unfortunately forced me to lose interest! I don’t understand why the devs chose to do this. They’ve essentially made the story incomplete for most players, as you certainly won’t find all the pillars in your first playthrough. They could have made it a narrated story in each stage, alongside the main story. Some developers fail to understand that the goal of games is enjoyment!

The only thing I really liked was the combat system—it’s genuinely fun. It’s based on striking, then dodging or parrying at the right moment. I thoroughly enjoyed the combat system and never got bored of it throughout the game.

185694118.review:
Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice is a pretty interesting game. I'm honestly not sure how this flew under my radar back in 2017. It's been sitting in my library for quiet some time and it's only a few days ago that I finally tried it. I am relatively pleased to have done so.

At it's core, Hellblade truly is just a walking simulator set in incredibly gorgeous and creative environments with a bunch of puzzles sprinkled in.  The very few times you aren't walking is during combat. This game's combat is very simplistic and often feels repetitive as it features very few combos and moves. It's so simple in fact that the game doesn't even see it necessary to give the player a tutorial. Like at all.  This game's overall game play and control scheme is so straight forward that a monkey can learn it at a glance.Where Hell blade shines, however, is in it's phenomenal story telling that's presented masterfully by the fantastic performances of the voice actors, the creative visuals (that brings the world. story and its characters o life) and complex themes. 

This game truly is all about story, and not much about game play at all.  The entire experience feels and plays like a literal animated movie that just happens to let you press a few keys to move the character from one scene to another. So this begs the question, why not just release a movie instead? It'd most likely be cheaper and potentially reach a much wider audience. Regardless, this game features some of the best directing I've ever seen in any games thus far. The shots, the visual creativity and the scenes. Every shot in this game feels like it's been done carefully to present the story in a very creative and meaningful way. From a narrative perspective, this game truly has it all. Lastly, it's very impressive how committed this game is to presenting mental illness so accurately and realistically.  Not many projects are brave enough to even tackle this topic let alone present it in all it's morbid glory. Props to the team for that.

This game's game-play is indeed boring. Had the story and the narrative been lacking, this game certainly would've been pretty terrible. But it's not, and because of it's masterclass story telling, the combat simply did not need to be creative, or even really that good. It ended up being just fine, just fine enough to compliment the game's experience while still keeping your attention on the plot. The puzzles are my biggest complaint. I detest puzzles. Like so much. So perhaps this is quiet subjective. This game's puzzles ranged anywhere from "that was alright" to "i want to quit the game" for me. To add onto that, I felt like this game overstayed it's welcome a little bit. I completed the game in 10 hours, but had it been 6 or 8, I do believe it would've been much more enjoyable. It would've hit that perfect short but sweet spot. I only say this because by the 8th hour of playing this game, I was really getting fed up and tired of the puzzles. I was just looking forward to the game ending.

To conclude, this is a good game if you're really into atmosphere, great deep stories and complex characters/lore. It's very story rich and dark, which I love. It's a shame some aspects of the gameplay were a bit of a let down, but all in all, still a very solid and enjoyable experience.
7/10

Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice is a game that combines an amazing story with fabulous graphics. It truly captures what it's like to be overwhelmed and on the verge of giving up. Every step of the journey mirrors the internal struggle of facing one's fears, giving me a clear perspective on my own mental battles.

The game’s realism stands out as it strips away any special or otherworldly abilities, forcing Senua to rely solely on belief in myself and my cause. This makes the experience all the more compelling.

The incorporation of Norse mythology is a nice touch, adding depth and intrigue as I explore lorestones and uncover captivating stories. The fighting mechanics are simple yet effective, and the voices that warn Senua of attacks from behind add an immersive layer to the gameplay.

Overall, Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice is a profound and impactful game that excels in both narrative and execution.

A big thank you to the development team for creating such an exceptional and thought-provoking experience. Your dedication and hard work have truly paid off, and I am grateful for the immersive world you've brought to life.

185474596.review:
I bought this game a few years ago because I'm a rubbish gamer and I was looking for games that might not demand a high level of game-pad skills in order to play. I played it for an hour or so and then left it...for no particular reason. I returned to it recently because I'm interested in the new game, so thought I should finish the original before I invested in the new one - duh.

Since the original test, I've played stuff like Assassin's Creed Odyssey, Witcher 3 and Kingdom Come Deliverance. I'm still a rubbish gamer, but these other games seem to have furnished me with some skills in order to prepare me for Hellblade, which is much more combat-heavy than I was expecting.

Combat itself is pretty straightforward and can even get a bit repetitive at times (I wish they'd introduce a few more baddies, or at least give the standard baddies a few more skins) but it's challenging (I played it on "auto" difficulty...which is a bit confusing as a concept, but  online searches seem to suggest that this difficulty is  more difficult than "hard", so I persevered) and it's VERY gratifying when you do get a perfect hit or massacre a bunch of creepy baddies coming at ya.

Puzzles can be challenging too, but most of them have a visual element which I find unusual, and which I like, seeing as I'm a visual learner.

The game itself is pretty unique. It doesn't hold your hand. There are no tutorials. no HUD, no map, no mini-map, no inventory, no side-quests. It just drops you into Senua's story and you have to deal with that and move forward. I loved this about the game, a very refreshing departure.

It's pretty short but it's intense and it will leave you thinking for many hours...I think.

It's a visual feast (not just Senua - whom I want to marry, despite her psychosis) the game is beautiful. Oh, and listen to what they say about playing it with headphones - sound is amazing!

It deals with some very hard-hitting mental issues too - be warned about this if your mental state is fragile. There are links in the load-screen to follow if you feel you need them, and reach out to friends, family and/or local/governmental agencies if you're feeling down - there's lots of stuff you can access online.

People care about you.

You matter.

You're not alone. X

The story is amazing, and the visuals, music, voice acting, and sound design are brilliant. The level design is solid, too. Sadly, the game is ruined by a tacked-on combat system.

In close spaces, the game usually gives the player the worst camera angle possible, making it impossible to see where Senua is. Dodging or parrying is then all about luck, with the expected results when three enemies attack the protagonist from all sides one after the other.

I played at the "normal" combat difficulty mode until I reached Helheim, where I was eventually forced to lower it to "easy" in an attempt to survive this specific fight, to no avail. I'm now unable to progress any further because the camera is basically working for the enemy. Dying and restarting a combat ten times in a row isn't fun, it's frustrating. That's too bad because the combat moves themselves are easy to master and are a breeze to use in larger areas.

That was the first and last time I bought a game from this developer. They should make movies or walking simulators, not combat video games.

185412981.review:
An incredible  journey that should not be spoiled and is worth a play though. It only takes about 8 hours to 100%, is more cinematic than action, and has 0 replayability...so just be aware of that when deciding what price is right for you. Pick it up on a sale, or at least that's what I did. But the music, atmosphere, world building, and mythical lore are fantastic. The dialogue and voice acting are second to none and with a high end graphics card, it looks more like a movie than a video game.

I am not sure what all the jibber jabber about mental health and that weird "trigger warning" at the beginning are all about. They apparently paid for "mental heath advisers" for reasons that makes about as much sense as wheels on a frying pan. This game is a fantasy adventure about a woman seeking the soul of her dead lover and risking Hel to find it. It has magic and myth all wrapped up in some easy combat and a little exploration with puzzles. Highly recommend for the vast majority of people. And for those that may find a fantasy video game where the voices of the dead speak to you too triggering, I suggest monopoly.

[h2] Bu Oyunda Psikoz Temsilleri Yer Almaktadır. [/h2]

[b] Bu tasvirler için psikiyatri uzmanlarının yanı sıra psikoz deneyimi olan kişilerden yardım alınmıştır. [/b]

Bir oyun düşünün, size psikoz deneyimleyen bir karakteri tamamen hissettirebilmek için gerçekten psikoz deneyimlemiş kişilerden yardım almış bir oyun düşünün. Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice, gerek hikayesi olsun gerek görüntü şöleni olsun gerek psikoz hissini yansıtışı olsun gerekse dövüş mekanikleri olsun gerçekten çok üst düzey bir yapım. Bunları parça parça ele almak daha doğru olacaktır.

[h3] Hikaye [/h3][hr][/hr]
Oyunumuzun hikayesini spoiler vermeden anlatmak gerekirse ilk öncelikle oyunda çok sayıda sinematik sahne bulunmakta. Bu sinematik sahneler oyunun hikayesini bize aktarmakta ve bizi hikayenin içerisine çekmekte. Ayrıca oyunda İskandinav mitolojisini anlatan taşlar bulunmakta, bu taşları bularak İskandinav mitolojisi hakkında da fikir edinebilmekteyiz. Hikayesinin çok güzel olduğunu, hatta benim hikayeyi anlamak için bir açıklama videosu izlemem gerektirecek kadar karmaşık ama bir o kadar da güzel olduğunu söylememe gerek yoktur zaten.

[h3] Görüntü [/h3][hr][/hr]
Tek kelime: gerçekçi. Uzun uzun anlatmaya gerek yok. Grafikleri gerçekten çok güzel, oyuna başladığınız ilk saniyeden itibaren de bunu göreceksiniz zaten.

[h3] Psikoz [/h3][hr][/hr]
Kulaklık takmadan oynamak zorunda kaldığımı söylemek ile başlayayım. Oyundaki sesler kulaklıkla o kadar gerçekçi ki ben oyunu oynarken kulaklık takamadım, hatta bazı sahnelerde arkada şarkı açarak oynamayı tercih ettim. Gerçekten bu konu için bile aşırı derecede uğraşmışlar, saygı duymak lazım.

Öğrenmesi kolay ve göze çok hoş gelen bir dövüş mekaniği var. Özellikle rakip saldırıları kılıcımızla tam anında engellediğimizde oluşan o ağır çekim an gerçekten oyunun en başından sonuna kadar beni hayran bıraktı. Siz de dövüş mekaniklerini çok seveceksiniz.

Oyun sadece dövüş üzerine değil, bol bol da illüzyon temelli bulmaca da var. Böylece çok yönlü bir oynanışa izin veriyor. [b] Oyunu alıp kesinlikle oynayın[/b], daha da uzatmama gerek yok bence.

Definitely among the unique games i've played so far and this game does a great job of showing what people suffering from mental illness has to go through. The game offers little when it games to gameplay and mechanics but man does it deliver when to comes to story and environment. Senua goes through literal hell to save her lover's soul and her psychosis doesn't do her any favors as she constantly struggles with voices inside her head doubting & distracting her throughout the game. As players we get a front seat in her mind and team ninja has executed this concept masterfully, u get to feel what she's going through. The game looks beautiful even today, even though the story is quite short and gameplay leaves a lot to be desired, there's some gameplay mechanics that are just great and adds to this game's mystique, u have to play it to appreciate it.

[h3]Do i recommend this game?[/h3]
[b]Yes[/b]
[h3]Is it worth the price?[/h3]
[b]Yes but get it on sale if can[/b]

мое единственное разочарование в том, что я так поздно для себя решил поиграть в этот шедевр.
за последние годы большего впечатления, чем от Hellblade, пожалуй, я не получал ни с какой игры любого жанра.
без порядка:

коротко, мы – кельтская воительница Сенуа в мрачном мире мертвых в поисках своего возлюбленного.
одно из первых на что обратил внимание – отсутствие привычных атрибутов жанра – карты, инвентаря, полоски здоровья и тд. никаких стрелочек, указателей, да хоть чего-нибудь. нет ничего.
вокруг только ад.
свыкнувшись с управлением (куда нажимать, где клацать!?) ты наконец видишь её величество графику. детализация персонажа сумасшедшая, не только в кат-сценах, но и в ходе всей игры.
кста, главная героиня – Сенуа, не похожа на классическую "героиню". она не супер сексапильная красотка и не поражает воображение набором своих положительных качеств типо храбрости и воинственности. 
она ОБЫЧНАЯ и от этого ты сразу чувствуешь близость между вами.
но это, конечно, только на первый взгляд обычная, да. 
за 15 часов игры успеваешь несколько раз застрять в маятнике "Сенуа чокнутая – Сенуа нормальная", потом засомневаться в собственной адекватности и так и не получить внутреннего вразумительного ответа о том что такое вообще "нормально" ╮( ˘ ､ ˘ )╭
детализация и прорисовка локаций очень крутая, учитывая выход игры в 17-м году и мои впечатления о ней уже в 25-м. добавить нечего

боевка и общая система прохождения это пункт, о котором даже если очень захочется – особо ничего хорошего не скажешь. бои унылые и нет никакой системы – тыкаешь мечом, уклоняешься, и так по кругу. чем дальше проходил игру, тем больше хотелось бы, чтобы боёв (кроме как с боссом) не было вообще. порой начинали раздражать. враги то бесконечно прут один за другим и не видно им конца и края, то час-полтора бродишь не встретив вообще никого и теряется игровое напряжение. в начале писал про отсутствие шкалы хп у героя. так вот её нет ни у тебя, ни у врагов и оценивать долго ли ещё осталось тыкать мечом в босса можно только чисто визуально, а оценивать долго ли ещё смогут тыкать мечом в тебя – по заразе, распространяющейся на руке. 
кста в самом начале игры недвусмысленно намекнули, что если зараза расползётся и достигнет головы, то мы умрём и начнём всё сначала
реалистичненько и одобряемо.

ещё одна важная инфа. игра полностью линейна(!). т.е. линейнее некуда. у тебя нет возможности выбрать абсолютно ничего. ты даже не можешь разделаться с каким-то квестом раньше/позже/другим способом. даже не можешь слинять от врагов за пределы боевой площадки. способ и правильный ответ всегда только один.

атмосфера бешенная. мейби и в прямом и в переносном. по мере прохождения, происходящая вокруг вакханалия воспринимается уже спокойнее т.к. склонность человеческого мозга к адаптации воспринимать как данность дичайший кошмар или, на первый взгляд, невозможный бред.
руки из стен? – оки, почему бы и нет.
живешь эти 15 часов игры по правилам безумного мира в который тебя погрузили. разрабам удалось не просто показать как выглядит психоз, а заставить жить с психозом, посидеть в этой шкуре.
а для тех, кто не уловил психические проблемы героини – есть набор страхов попроще – высоты, темноты и жутких тварей в ней, одиночества, смерти. успеешь испытать все понемногу.

игра 9 из 10 шедевров
в надежде, что вторая часть не разочарует.

The game is very linear. You're mostly running from point A to B and doing arduous gate "puzzles" to open them, which often just takes you out of the story itself and becomes tedious after the 3rd time. Also the chronic talking (inside) the head of the protagonist just becomes too much after a while. It's more so distracting than of any value to the story and disrupts your immersion. I think they could've definitely toned that down.

There is no environmental story-telling, nor any reason to revisit the previous areas, and often you can't. Coming from the Resident Evil games where there is a heck of a lot more to their games than just running from A to B, I just put this game aside. It's boring, repetitive, and definitely not worth its pricing for this type of gameplay. Come on. 

Positive notes: beautiful graphics and great narration/reading by the VA's.

185231943.review: Overall, I enjoyed this game. It takes the difficult topic of mental illness, and makes it understandable to players who are not familiar with it. The overall story is a fairly basic revenge story. A loved one is killed and the protagonist goes a a revenge quest.  Adding Senua's psychosis to the story adds a unique spin on one of the most over done tropes in games, movies, and books. There are only two negative points for me. The main one is that combat can be a little tricky. Senua seems to move a little slower than the enemies in combat. The other issue is one that I think was intentional by the games designers. The objectives are sometimes hard to figure out, and can leave you wandering around trying to figure out what you are supposed to do. I liked that this aspect added to the disorientation presented by Senua's psychosis. It would have been nice to have a hint button, since a couple of times I had to peak at a walkthrough to figure out how to move on.

185211808.review:
Although I have mixed feelings about this game, I would recommend playing it, but: unless you are truly eager, I would wait for it to be discounted in one of the regular Steam sales, because; if you neither replay parts of it, nor watch the video that is included via the main menu, you can finish it in under 10 hours.  

I shall try to avoid any spoilers in this review, except for something that you either might read in the introduction on the store page, or that becomes obvious within the first minutes of gameplay.  

The story is engaging, with a mix of history and mythology, as you play the Celtic young woman (a Pict from the Orkney islands) called Senua, who wanders into a world based on Norse mythology. 

The cons of this game are the fact it is very linear and you get much less gameplay than say: The Witcher III.  

The graphics are generally good, although there were a few minor glitches where your view was sometimes obscured by the enemy you were fighting, or you could see through objects if you rotated the view.  

As someone who is not a big fan of most of puzzles you find in games, this was not to my liking, nor were the tasks you had to hurry to finish in a certain time or has to restart from the last save.  

It is daring that they discuss certain topics in the game, such as mental health issues, and not everyone might like to see a world through the eyes of someone who experiences this.  

Instead of a strong and independent fighter like a lot of games, Senua talks about her issues, losses, troubles quite a lot during the game. You have to be okay with this introspective narrative. 
 
The game was good enough for me to check out the sequel, in the future.

185136122.review:
A game about madness. A game to drive you mad.

I was somehow under the impression that it was an action game. In reality, it’s more of a visual novel-like game with puzzles and some combat elements. I’d describe 'Senua: Hellblade' as the 'Dark Souls' of visual novels.

There's no HUD, no tutorial, and no tips. I played using a full guide and managed to enjoy it; otherwise, I would have abandoned it since I strongly dislike one of the common puzzle types here — where you need to pass through portals to change minor elements of the environment as a solution.

The story unfolds slowly, and most of the time, you're just simmering in the cauldron of insanity alongside the main character.

This game isn't for everyone. It’s beautiful, but also weird. Get it on sale if you're curious. 

Fun fact: It’s interesting to track people’s opinion about this game through achievements. Players either give up after the introductory chapters or see it through to the end. Quite uncommon thing

185075869.review:
This is a must play game I would recommend to players who like a singleplayer game with interesting puzzles and good combat with a very engaging story.

I will start with the story it is one of  the best part about this game. You play as a girl named Senua obviously who is a female viking Celtic warrior and the game is set in the viking error with the viking myth and lore. She is the last viking left alive and is  one a quest to viking Hell to defeat the God Hela and fight for the soul of her dead lover. On top of that Senua suffers with mental illness and a dark past. She hears voices and sees hallucinations which all play a part in the story as well. The game does a really good job of blending it all together and making you feel for the character and people with mental illness altogether.   

Now onto the gameplay. Firstly the combat.  Some people put shit on this part of the game but there is more than I expected there to be in this area of  the game. You only have 1 weapon and there are no skills or abilities to unlock but I wasn't expecting that from this game. The game itself linear for the most part and isn't very long with only about 11 chapters. You do have however a light attack and Heavy attack which you can string together for combos in whatever order you desire. You also have a running light and heavy attack which can start combos as well. On top of that you have some nice defensive mechanics as well such as a last second parry and cool movement options like sidestepping and back-stepping. You also get an ability you can use pretty early in the game that helps in combat a lot. The only thing that I didn't like about the combat was the fixed camera position during combat that kind of acts as a lock on mechanic which can be a problem sometimes esp when you encounter multiple enemies at once cause you can't change the camera position when  enemies are present.

The other aspects of gameplay include:

puzzles which is the other really good thing about this game. I have never quite come across puzzles like the ones in this game before. They are unique, can be challenging and are engaging.

finding lore-stones which is the only side thing in the game but is worth it cause you will find out more about the lore of the vikings via finding them. And if you find them all you will unlock a special small side story content. The only issue is t he game doesn't really tell you this. But you can go through chapter select and redo  chapters again to get all the lore stones which is cool. 

Enemies and bosses. There were enough enemy variants introduced throughout the game that all attack differently and carry different weapons . The bosses are all unique as well and play a part in the lore or the story or both. They are beatable while being quite challenging as well. There was only one boss which can be a problem if your eye site isn't very good or clear cause he uses a specific visual trick quite a lot that makes the screen flash red and makes it hard to see him. You can roughly make him out before he does an attack during this sequence but your eye site needs to be pretty good. 

Controls which are basic and simple which is all they need to be. No issue with them at all.

Replay-ability unfortunately is almost non existent in this game but it is only a minor issue for this game since it is a story driven game and they are making a second one.  Outside of redoing chapters to get missed lore stones for the side story or doing the game again on a harder combat difficulty there is nothing much else to do. 

Now onto the visuals and performance. The visuals are pretty nice and the game takes advantage of ray tracing and other modern nvidia features since the graphics overhaul update if you have the right video card. Sensua also looks very lifelike and realistic esp in the face. The game perform pretty well but again your framerate will suffer a bit if you enable ray tracing on the highest setting unless you have a really high end RTX card. That said outside of that I have never had crashes or freezes with this game.  The graphic options are well thought through as well.

The music and sound for this game is really well done and suits the game and adds  to the experience even more. In fact listening to the game with headphones actually makes the game even  more immersive.

Overall I highly recommend this game for all gamers. It is a fun unique immersive story driven  singleplayer experience with  that should not be missed. I give it a 9/10

185004790.review:
[h2]Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice – шедевр, который не прощает ошибок, но дарит эмоции[/h2]

"Hellblade" — это не просто игра, а эмоциональный аттракцион, где на вас будут кричать голоса при погружении в ужасы атмосферных скандинавских миров.

[h2]🎮 Геймплей:[/h2]
Сначала кажется, что это симулятор ходьбы с элементами "найди символ в куче мусора". Так и есть, но ближе к концу игра вспоминает, что боёвка — это весело. Сражения хоть и простые, но зрелищные: слабые и сильные удары, пинок, блок, перекат... Анимации тут такие, что хочется взять попкорн. Иногда враги заходят в спину, но голоса в голове вовремя предупредят: "Эй, смотри назад!". Всё честно, если не лениться двигаться.

[h2]🤔 Загадки:[/h2]
Игра любит заставлять вас искать символы в окружении. Сначала это увлекательно, а потом – утомительно. Иногда проще обратиться за помощью к YouTube, чем пытаться понять, чего хочет игра.

[h2]📖 Сюжет и атмосфера:[/h2]
Сенуа — героиня с психозом, идёт к богине смерти, чтобы вернуть любимого. По пути — драма, голоса, боссы из скандинавской мифологии и необычная концовка, которая либо удивит, либо разочарует. Это больше путешествие в глубины человеческого сознания, чем просто игра. Кстати, разработчики консультировались с людьми, переживающими психоз, чтобы всё выглядело максимально правдоподобно. И это действительно работает.

[h2]🖼 Графика и звук:[/h2]
Красота окружения и жуткие детали скандинавских мрачных миров впечатляют. Каждую локацию хочется рассматривать, как картину. А лицевая анимация Сенуи — прям отлично. Ну а звук — это ASMR для ушей. Голоса шепчут, кричат, спорят — берите наушники, не пожалеете! 🎧 Звук — это прям то, из-за чего стоит играть в это.

[h2]✔️ Итог:[/h2]
"Hellblade" — это игра, которая не для всех. Она проста геймплейно, медитативна, жутка и эмоционально сложна. Да, геймплей иногда однообразен, а загадки раздражают. Но её атмосфера, графика и сюжет искупают все недостатки, а звук — эталон саунд-дизайна! Это больше чем игра — это опыт, который заставляет задуматься.
Рекомендую, если готовы к погружению в голову Сенуи. Если нет — всё равно попробуйте, кто знает, вдруг вам понравится.

184971950.review:
The quick and dirty recommendation guide (pick as many +/- points as you like and make up your mind if it's worth buying):
+ strong narrative
+ outstanding sound and visual presentation
+ responsive, intense and simple combat
+ nightmarish horror atmosphere (without jump scares)
+ superb voice acting
+ frightening and well-designed end bosses
+/- combat lacks complexity and may be too simple for some
+/- no replay value (it may have for a revisited experience)
+/- bit short, which is compensated by fair price and gameplay without tedious and lengthy grinds
+/- high stylized presentation of events and plot may not be everyone's taste (totally mine, though)
- gameplay doesn't offer much variety
- not much to explore apart from lore stones telling you about Norse mythology (which is quite important, however!)
- lack of variety in enemies and their appearance

The details:

Hellblade tells a story about suffering, sacrifice, darkness and endeavor. Following the story of Picts warrior maid Senua, you embark on a nightmarish and mind-twisting journey to Helheim, to save a beloved one’s soul. However, for Senua, many things aren’t what they’re supposed to be, for she’s suffering from severe psychosis. While you often can’t decide what’s real and what not, you must overcome many obstacles and enemies – the latter seemingly coming right out of Hel(l).

No other game, up to this point, managed to devour me – getting me so immersed – like Hellblade did. This game just pulled me deeper than any other game has accomplished in recent years, and I, mentally, switched off everything else around me and Senua’s reality became mine. The sound design and visual presentation is outstanding.

I was always a fan of non-linear storytelling and Hellblade totally nailed it. Its presentation is intriguing, captivating and keep you ever so interested in what happened (to Senua) and how everything will turn out.

As for the gameplay I was kind of surprised of what they came up with: There's a level where there is nothing but darkness and you have to find your way out, without fighting, only using your senses, as Senua's reaching out with her hand to frisk her surroundings, or running from one light source to another to not getting devoured by darkness. In other parts, cynically spoken, you could call it 'walking simulator', but, as for myself, I was so immersed in the world that I didn't mind. It doesn’t deliver any boredom even when ‘nothing’ happens.

There is one thing to explore off the main paths, however: Lore stones. These stones – telling you about Norse mythology in appearance of an old friend – are optional but critical in further expanding on the whole game’s story. At first one might not see the entangled meaning of Norse mythology and it seems rather random, just to give this game a Norse touch although you're not playing a viking heroine. Certainly, Vikings are involved in the story but that doesn’t necessarily explain why you keep hearing stories about the Northmen. But keep your wits about you and you’ll come to realize the importance of those stories.

I also enjoyed the combat, although it lacks complexity and deep mechanics. So, what is to like about it? Its responsiveness and simplicity made it a blast to play. It is quick, brutal, intense and it just works without any clumsiness. In that regard it is sort of 'flawless', straight on point. Don't expect anything near like Dark Souls, though.

Visual clues were used in a clever way and weren't spelled out boldly for you with exclamation marks, compass needles and the like. Even in one given situation where acting under pressure and time limit was required, I managed to find all the necessary clues at the first try without said compass needle or other HUD markers pointing out where to go – there are voices telling you to "focus" or to look in another direction. The lack of (almost) any meta information fits the theme of the game and it is an enjoyable change in a video game. That being said, there's no "meta game" telling you how to do things (apart from the game options menu). No HUD, no text boxes or pop ups. Everything you need to know to beat the game is offered by the environments and from 'within' the game.

It absolutely has become one of my favorite games by now at this time.

Я пройшов гру під назвою "Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice" і залишився дуже приємно вражений. Гра захоплює з перших хвилин і тримає в напрузі до самого кінця, хоча спочатку мені знадобився деякий час, щоб влитися. Поступово, квест за квестом, битва за битвою, бос за босом, тебе охоплюють емоції, інтерес до історії, а також переживання за головну героїню і розв'язку її історії.

Особливо мені сподобалося те, що гру не затягнули, всі події розвиваються лаконічно і в тему. Графіка на високому рівні, що додає грі особливого шарму. Інтерфейс меню та налаштувань, хоча й виглядає дещо дешево, проте, це не заважає насолоджуватись процесом гри.

Окремо варто відзначити візуальні та аудіо складові, які є найвищого рівня. Звуковий супровід і візуальні ефекти створюють неперевершену атмосферу, що допомагає ще глибше зануритися у світ Senua.

Загалом, "Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice" залишила дуже позитивні враження, і я рекомендую цю гру всім, хто цінує якісні історії та атмосферні ігрові світи.

184722768.review:
Всем кто  не понял Hellblade.
Эту игру надо чувствовать, а не просто знать, что эмоции существуют. Надо прислушаться не за тем, чтобы просто услышать, а чтобы понять. Это самая подходящая и нужная игра для любого человека, который каждый день борется со своими демонами и своей тьмой. Сенуа даёт каждому из нас шанс почувствовать себя … не одиноким. Она вручает нам в руки легитимное право бояться, когда страшно, убегать, когда плохо и никто, совсем никто, не имеет никакого права упрекнуть или наставить на 'верный путь'.
Я тоже не понимаю Hellblade, но обязательно постараюсь это сделать.
Я оглядываясь через плечо и пытаюсь вслушаться в доносящийся словно издалека крик. Человек не может так кричать, животное не может так кричать. Я касаюсь своих губ и понимаю лишь одно.Это голос внутри, который прям нашептывает спрыгнуть в бездну со сколы. Интересно а такие известные люди как: Гейси младший, Хеннард, Мякила или даже Ван Гог, тоже его слышали.Хотелось бы понять, почему именно так и не иначе, они думали и совершали какие-то действия. Если они видели что-то, чего не видели другие, то что это было и как выглядело. Если они слышали кого-то, то кого? Чьи это голоса, были ли они звонкими и давали ли они спать.
Фрейд писал, что психоз - это протест. Состояние, при котором человек не избегает реальности, а перестраивает её, не отрицает, а пытается изменить. И переработка этой реальности происходит на основе уже существующих воспоминаний, суждений и мнений. Это очень важно понять и важно отличать. Сейчас это кажется логичным, в 1924 это было откровением, а в 790 до нашей эры Фрейда и меня сожгли бы на костре. Но эта игра не про психоз и даже не про путешествие. По крайней мере на первый взгляд.

Это любовь.
И нам позволяют стать на пару десятков часов свидетелем всего того прекрасного и ужасного, что может это чувство дать. Главное - позволить себе увидеть, услышать, почувствовать. Сенуа уже умеет всё это, поэтому никто в этой игре ничего не объясняет. И не должен. 
Мы - свидетели с уникальной возможностью увидеть историю.
Мы - ещё один голос в её голове.

Это история о девушке. Она больна, она устала и ей жутко страшно. Вам когда-нибудь было страшно? Замирало сердце, когда на улице вдруг останавливались как вкопанный и засомневались закрыли ли дверь? Пропустили ли мамино день рождение, не потеряли ли ключ, а вдруг уволят, а если не сдам…Наша жизнь полна страхом, самым неподдельным и искренним чувством, какое только может быть у человека. И в данном случае, главное - это правильно расставить акценты. Эта история не про страх, но про то, как его преодолеть, не про смерть - а борьбу с ней, не про психоз - а видение мира.
При создании Hellblade, разработчики не только консультировались с профессором психиатрии, но и со множеством людей с самыми различными видами психологических расстройств и психозов. И у меня сердце замирало, когда я видела в ролике этих скромно жавшихся по стульям людей, которые неотрывно и жадно смотрели первый геймплей, слышали голоса в голове героя, видели знаки, которых нет, наблюдали, как Сенуа плачет и кричит обессиленная, уставшая, раненая. Смотрели и были благодарны. Это, наверное, словно сказанное вслух слово, которое не мог вспомнить очень долго и не мог объяснить. Это как вытащить образы из головы и наконец обрести возможность наглядно показать, каково это. Дать людям увидеть свой мир и понять, что ты больше не одинок.
Каждый из нас борется со своей тьмой. Каждый день. Можно рассказать об этом, можно объяснить, можно перечитать сотни книг и посмотреть столько же фильмов. Но Hellblade даёт нам куда как больше, чем может дать любой рассказ: увидеть своими глазами, услышать, пережить, перечувствовать. Это не просто игра, это опыт. Сконцентрированный, проработанный, красочный опыт. Словно загрузить в себя память другого человека и побыть на пару часов кем-то не собой, но тем, кто понимает.

Ну и на чистоту. Когда мы думаем о человеке с психологическим заболеванием в видеоигре, кто приходит на ум? Кто-то определённо сумасшедший. Полный псих. Неадекват. Джокер? Может даже Ваас из Far Cry 3. Но точно Чувак из Postal. Кто-то хладнокровный, расчётливый, кто-то со своей внутренней религией. А может Ричард Трагер из Outlast или Мастер Оригами из Heavy Rain. И точно убийца. Да, он должен убивать.
И словно в противовес, как взгляд с другой стороны альтернативной реальности - Сенуа. Лава из крови, пепельный дождь, непрекращающийся кошмар. Напуганная, но сильная.
Эта игра даёт надежду. Даже не смотря на то, что в ней можно столкнуться с настоящей тьмой. В каждом из нас есть немного воина. Чтобы это ни было, у главной героини игры это получилось. Сделать первый шаг из тьмы, очнуться, принять. В следующий раз, когда закат будет особо прекрасен, на мне футболка из хлопка и на один кредит меньше, я вспомню о том, каким был голос в моей голове. И о том, что победила чувство погрузиться в эту тьму отчаяния в которой живут многие люди нашей планеты.

184686767.review:
I tend to go into games as blind as possible, never watching trailers or reading reviews before getting a game for fear of spoilers; In this instance I'd recommend going in with a little fore-knowledge.
The fore-knowledge that would have helped me is that this is mainly a walking simulator with a primary focus on narrative, loosely scattered with a handful of gameplay elements.

This game was visually impressive for its time and holds up reasonably well at the start of 2025, the combat (what little there is of it) is pretty well put-together and flows nicely.
 The puzzles are almost entirely perspective based, a format that will be familiar to you if you played Superliminal, Viewfinder, or a number of other games where challenges are solved by aligning yourself in such a way that map details appear to morph into specific shapes or patterns. This type of puzzle becomes fairly repetitive and seems to be mainly used as a backdrop for you slowly walking around listening to narration or the 'audio log' style recordings that play when you find lodestones, illuminating more of the story.

The sound design is genuinely something impressive, the 360 binaural recordings and rich atmospheric backing probably represent some of the best sound engineering I've heard in any game to this day.

I am aware that there is a lot of love for this game, I have a lot of respect for what the devs achieved, but a few things keep me from recommending it:

The 'running speed' is tediously slow, especially when you factor in that there are a number of points where you need to backtrack a significant distance to advance the game, these are the moments I would recommend playing long dialogue sections, if needed at all.

If you are interested in the story you are frequently forced to stop progressing and just stand still to hear the end of a piece of dialogue because interacting with anything else will often stop it from playing(want to open a door and listen at the same time? too bad, Senua doesn't multi-task), add into this that some pieces of audio emanate from a specific location within the map, meaning again that you have to stand within 20m and passively listen before you can continue else the audio fades into inaudibility. 

*Spoiler*
[spoiler]The biggest problem of all for me came at the end, the final fight with "Hela" a symbolic fight with an ending that many of the game's fans seem to love, but ripped me out of the experience altogether. You are subjected to infinite(you don't know this yet) waves of enemies after doing a mini boss run, but enemies that are no more challenging than earlier in the game, personally I believed that the difficulty was supposed to be coming from the small arena, limited space and number of enemies all attacking you at once. 
It was just enough to convince me that the devs thought this should be a challenge, but an achievable one, rather than something I was supposed to be overwhelmed by or succumb to begrudgingly, instead after around 20 minutes of mindlessly slaying goons I paused to google whether this fight was ever supposed to end and found a _bunch_ of other people online who had fought this fight for 10, 20, 40 minutes, an hour even.

 I understand some people will argue that this makes for a great final fight because it's so symbolic of the fight Senua is having with her own realisation about her mental health and the fate of Dillian but that's just not a good enough answer to me. It may well be an accurate analogy for psychosis and/or deeply symbolic but one thing I found it not to be was satisfying.
If a game ever causes me to pause and google something because I'm getting bored, it has lost me in narrative terms. I did my googling, alt-tabbed back in, and let myself get hit.... by the time the final cinematic played i just felt like I had had my time wasted.

Now, I'm sure some will also say that if I'd listened to the story I would know that Senua was supposed to lose, I did, and knew she was, but that doesn't mean I was certain _when_ nor did it feel great that that loss had to come from me actively giving up. In a game that warns you at the start not to fail because the darkness will grow within you, and that when that darkness progresses enough you'll lose your progress... the thought of having to run at 3mph for another few hours to get back to this point was a strong incentive not to die.[/spoiler]

184598537.review:
JOGO NOTA 7.9/10
História sem explicação -> 4/10
História com explicação -> 8.5/10
Gráficos -> 10/10
Trilha sonora -> 8/10
Jogabilidade -> 9/10

Sabe quando o roteiro tenta ser complexo, adicionando informações fragmentadas que não são conectadas ou não muito bem explicadas e acaba ficando a desejar? Assim é a história de Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice, você pensa que o roteiro vai ganhar grandes proporções, mas o jogo continua monótono. Na verdade, os totens que aparecem repetidas vezes no jogo contam histórias "fillers", no qual nada é adicionado na escassa história principal, apenas confundem o jogador. Joga a sua atenção no lixo. Você termina o jogo da mesma forma que começou, sem entender muita coisa, exceto que a personagem principal está em uma saga sinistra por amor e vingança. Eu gostei do jogo, mas convenhamos, o desfecho é ruim demais. 

O que ajuda a entender a história é o vídeo intitulado "Hellblade: Senua's Psychosis" que pode ser encontrado no menu principal, só aí que a história ganha peso verdadeiro e tudo começa a se encaixar! Merece uma nota baixa nesse aspecto sim, pois não deveria depender de um vídeo bônus para explicar a história do jogo.

Existem alguns bugs nas batalhas, pois o jogo alterna entre exploração e batalha, Senua deve sacar a espada ao entrar numa batalha e isso pode não ocorrer e também não morre no combate, o que faz você ter que sair para o menu principal e retomar o jogo; outro que faz ela correr sem sair do lugar; e outro que faz você ver o outro lado do mapa ao encostar numa parede e rotacionar a visão. Não são tão recorrentes, mas podem acontecer. 

As batalhas impressionam bastante, porém são muito repetitivas e o que o jogo faz para aumentar a dificuldade ou apenas alternar o estilo um pouco é aumentar a quantidade de inimigos. Mas é perdoável porque a intenção do game é a imersão e porque tem chefões de alta qualidade. Os vilões básicos também são bem feitos. Na real, os puzzles são mais cansativos do que complexos pois leva mais tempo indo de uma área a outra do que raciocinando, ao se aproximar do final ficam bem fáceis.

Enfim, dada a crítica negativa, seguirei falando das coisas boas. O jogo é lindo e muito imersivo! As batalhas são realmente impressionantes, você sente cada golpe de ataque ou de defesa. Cada boss tem a sua especialidade. Apesar da personagem ter apenas uma arma - a espada, a quantidade de golpes diferentes e o combo entre eles te fazem esquecer disso! A junção da batalha, da paisagem e da trilha sonora te faz ficar vidrado! A narração e a trilha sonora são muito bons também, independente se o roteiro está indo bem ou não. Super cinematográfico. Senua é muito bem construída e a psicose dela é algo que é único e é a propaganda do game. A imersão, a profundidade das emoções e da loucura de Senua. A jornada em busca da verdade, em se sacrificar por quem ama, a ponto de enfrentar todas as suas fraquezas para isso. Na busca em distinguir o real do imaginário. Nisso, Hellblade é show demais!

E é isso... Compre na promoção por um bom desconto e jogue para aproveitar a imersão do jogo!

184186593.review:
[h2]Sinopsis[/h2]
Hellblade: Senua’s Sacrifice es un potente AA que sabe hacer una arriesgada apuesta. Se trata de una aventura en tercera persona donde priman la exploración, los puzzles y algunos combates espectaculares, tocando temas delicados como la salud mental de una manera brillante y original. Revestido de mitología nórdica, Hellblade nos narra la historia de Senua, una joven celta exiliada y repudiada por su padre y su tribu, debido a que compartía con su madre un oscuro legado, un don que la hace más sensible y perceptiva hacia lo sobrenatural. Senua lo ha perdido todo y su locura la ha conducido hasta el mismísimo Helheim, portando la cabeza de su difundo amante, Dillion, con la intención de recuperarlo de las garras de la muerte. Solo la diosa Hela es capaz de tan increíble milagro, pero llegar hasta ella se convertirá en un viaje hacia la más profunda locura, así como un desafío encomiable de superación personal y lucha contra sus propios miedos.

[h2]Jugabilidad / Apartado técnico[/h2]
La aventura de Senua nos llevará por todos los rincones del infierno vikingo, desde espectaculares escenarios abiertos hasta los más oscuros y recónditos entresijos de cuevas y mazmorras. A pesar de ser escenarios eminentemente lineales, tendremos cierta libertad para explorarlos y perdernos, ya que las ilusiones ópticas y las voces de nuestra cabeza no tardarán en nublarnos el juicio en reiteradas ocasiones. Cada zona nos planteará puzzles que resolver, así como runas escondidas por el escenario que deberemos localizar para desentrañar secretos y avanzar en la trama. Los combates no serán abundantes, pero he de decir que las mecánicas de lucha y los movimientos de Senua están perfectamente equilibrados y naturalizados, dando como resultado una experiencia audiovisual excelente y atractiva.

[h2]Valoración[/h2]
Hellblade es un juego anómalo, diferente y arriesgado, pero si se analiza en detalle es simplemente una obra maestra. Se trata de un juego con un potente apartado narrativo, que cuenta la historia de una persona perturbada y consumida por la locura. No esperes una historia alegre y feliz de superación personal, Hellblade es duro, es triste y es impasible. Detrás de su historia se esconde un trabajo excelente de investigación por parte de neurólogos y personas que sufren diversas enfermedades psicológicas, que han colaborado para traernos una experiencia realista y detallada (el juego cuenta con un documental que ilustra en detalle este trabajo). No es una aventura de acción al uso, no es su objetivo a pesar de hacer un buen trabajo, déjate llevar en el viaje de Senua, explora un mundo roto y disfruta de un apartado gráfico digno de elogio. Completar el juego al 100% puede llevarnos unas 9 horas, se puede disfrutar enteramente en Steam Deck y dispone de una versión VR incluida con el juego base.
Lo salvaría de un incendio! 👨‍🚒👍🔥

184026990.review:
[h1]Reseña de Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice [/h1]

[i]Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice[/i] es un juego que se destaca por su capacidad para fusionar una narrativa emocionalmente profunda con una jugabilidad innovadora y visualmente impresionante. Desarrollado por Ninja Theory, este título se adentra en los aspectos más oscuros de la mente humana, explorando temas como la psicosis y el trauma mental, todo ello a través de los ojos de Senua, una guerrera celta que lucha por rescatar el alma de su amado de las garras del inframundo.

[b]Lo que me ha gustado[/b]

Uno de los aspectos más sobresalientes de *Hellblade* es su enfoque en la representación realista de la psicosis. La forma en que el juego utiliza el sonido binaural para crear la sensación de voces en la cabeza de Senua es increíblemente inmersiva. Las voces no solo le hablan a Senua, sino que también nos invaden como jugadores, creando una experiencia inquietante y realista. Este aspecto no solo es un logro técnico, sino también una muestra de sensibilidad hacia la salud mental.

Visualmente, el juego es impresionante. Los paisajes sombríos y los escenarios del inframundo nórdico están llenos de detalles, y la captura de movimiento facial de Senua, protagonizada por Melina Juergens, transmite emociones de manera impresionante. La atmósfera del juego está cuidadosamente diseñada para mantener al jugador en un estado constante de tensión y desorientación, lo que es efectivo para involucrarlo emocionalmente.

La narrativa es otro de los puntos fuertes del juego. A través de una estructura no lineal, el jugador se adentra en el viaje de Senua de una manera que no solo le da profundidad al personaje, sino que también plantea preguntas filosóficas y psicológicas sobre la percepción de la realidad. El enfoque en el dolor y la superación personal es poderoso, y se maneja con una delicadeza que muchos juegos de este tipo no alcanzan.

[b]Lo que no me ha gustado[/b]

Si bien la experiencia narrativa es profunda, la jugabilidad puede volverse algo repetitiva. Aunque los combates son satisfactorios y las mecánicas de esquiva y ataque están bien diseñadas, las batallas pueden sentirse algo monótonas a medida que avanza el juego. A veces, el enfoque en la repetición de estas mecánicas puede hacer que el ritmo de la historia se vea afectado, sobre todo en las secciones más largas.

Otro punto que podría mejorarse son los puzzles, que aunque están bien integrados con la narrativa, a menudo requieren una cantidad considerable de tiempo para resolverse sin una sensación clara de progresión, lo que puede resultar frustrante.

[b]Recomendación[/b]

[i]Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice[/i] es un juego que no solo debe ser jugado, sino también experimentado. Si te interesa una historia profunda y emocionalmente compleja que aborde temas de salud mental con un enfoque único y valiente, este es un título que debes jugar. A pesar de algunos momentos de repetición en la jugabilidad, la experiencia general es algo que deja una marca en el jugador. Lo recomendaría especialmente a aquellos que buscan una narrativa madura y conmovedora, pero no es para los que buscan acción rápida o un juego sin desafíos emocionales.

Es un juego que, más allá de la diversión tradicional, invita a la reflexión y ofrece una experiencia que muchos otros juegos no logran. Sin duda, una obra recomendada para aquellos que busquen algo más que simple entretenimiento.

1. Ennui et répétitivité :
   - Le jeu est d'un ennui mortel.
   - Il est ultra répétitif et extrêmement lent.
   - Les dialogues sont longs et assommants.

2. Objectif de prolonger la durée de vie :
   - Tout semble conçu pour faire perdre du temps au joueur afin d'allonger la durée de vie du jeu.
   - On a plus l'impression d'écouter un livre audio que de jouer.

3. L’histoire et la confusion :
   - L’histoire pourrait être intéressante, mais elle devient confuse à cause de trop de noms, de mondes et de créatures.
   - Les voix omniprésentes et l'accumulation d'informations rendent difficile la compréhension, ce qui fait perdre l'intérêt.

4. Gameplay simpliste et combats monotones :
   - Le gameplay est trop simpliste et les combats deviennent rapidement répétitifs.

5. Conclusion :
   - Suite à cette expérience, je ne compte même pas essayer le deuxième opus, malgré la promotion.

183688371.review:
I know I'm Late for this game, but after a few years on my library I decided to give it a try.

It really suprised me: 

- Simple but satisfiying combat mechanics. 
- Top animations in story and in combat mode.
- Engaging lore.
- Amazing voice acting.

This game made me understand better how people with mental illness live. It is so well managed that the voices actually drives you crazy! They are there every second, telling you what to do and what not to do at the same time (thing that confuses you a LOT). For me is one of the most important parts of the game.

The story and the cutscenes are very well made, the lore is based in Norse Mythology and Celtic Culture. At one point I was lost in the story and have to pause it to do a little search over the internet about characters described on the story by the narrator.

The only thing I didn't like was the puzzles, it felt like I was losing time, just wanted to know more of the story or be in combat, but the repetitive puzzles to advance, broke the inmersion of the game. I know, I KNOW the puzzles are important to explain how psychosis manifests.

It was a really good experience. I wish that it had a mode only for combat after you finished the game.

As always, this is my personal opinion and is not intended to change anyones opinion over it.

183665553.review:
Essendo Natale, ho voluto farmi un regalo speciale, acquistando i due capitoli di Hellblade rispettivamente a 8 e 24 euro, entrambi quindi a prezzo scontatissimo, ben oltre il loro reale valore.

Inizio quindi a recensire il primo, che ho provato per pochi minuti, i quali mi sono bastati ampiamente per esprimermi.

Ancor più considerando che é un gioco del 2017, Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice é un realizzazione cineinterattiva tecnicamente sbalorditiva. Tanto che mi basterebbe già consigliarlo anche se fosse un benchmark.

L'atmosfera é a dir poco densa, coinvolgente, accuratissima in ogni dettaglio e tecnicamente sublime, la cui ottimizzazione permette difatti il pieno apprezzamento su qualsiasi scheda che tratti il Ray-Tracing.

Come noto, particolare cura e innovazione fu posta per le movenze ed espressioni della protagonista, che si muove con realismo assoluto, presto favorendo così ulteriore feeling d'immedesimazione con la trama, in un'ambientazione a dir poco affascinante.

Ci tengo a sottolineare che l'atmosfera é autenticamente spaventosa ed inquietante, ma senza cattivo gusto e cercando piuttosto di immedesimare il giocatore nelle crude terre antiche del Nord Europa, tra mito e realtà.

La realizzazione tecnica di Hellblade supera di gran lunga la maggior parte di realizzazioni cinematografiche che hanno goduto di investimenti ben più importanti, é un lavoro degnamente ammirevole, sorprendente e affascinante, considerando anche una trama non proprio banale e molto curata.

Avviso che mi esprimo dopo aver provato solo l'introduzione e i primi minuti di gioco, ma questo titolo ha una realizzazione tecnica tale da consigliarlo anche fosse stato un semplice benchmark, ad oggi godibile al meglio su qualsiasi PC considerabile come abbastanza recente.

E' uno di quei titoli da far vedere agli amici per stupirli positivamente, cosa che farò, ci tengo a precisa peraltro che non sono appassionato di horror, thriller né ambientazioni compatibili, tantomeno psicologiche, eppure per Hellblade non posso che applaudire in standing ovation, perché da competente nell'ambito garantisco che la qualità tecnica che esprime é di primissima qualità, sia considerandolo un videogioco tripla A che un'esperienza cinematografica interattiva, o entrambe.

Una pietra miliare per il realismo cinematografico nei videogiochi, ed oggi disponibile a un prezzo irrisorio. Non perdetevelo.

Voto: 10+/10

183575373.review:
Maintenant que j'ai achevé un playthrough complet six ans après le précédent, je peux confirmer ce que je disais de ce jeu après l'avoir achevé en 2018 : c'est une belle claque vidéoludique que je conseille vivement.

Côté gameplay c'est un jeu en vue tierce personne qui combine des puzzles de l'environnement et du combat au corps à corps. On alterne ces phases au fur et à mesure qu'on progresse dans l'environnement toujours en avant, le tout entrecoupés de cinématiques in-game qui font avancer l'histoire.

Le combat est exactement ce à quoi on peut s'attendre : attaque rapide, attaque lourde, blocage/parade, esquive, verrouillage automatique sur un ennemi à la fois. Un mécanisme de concentration  qui récompense le fait de ne pas prendre de dégats ou d'en provoquer permet d'activer un bullet-time qui est indispensable pour certains types d'ennemis. Par défaut la difficulté est dynamique selon comment on s'en sort, mais on peut la choisir entre trois niveaux. C'est vite pris en main et plutôt satisfaisant.

Les puzzles sont plus intéressants mais ne font pas exploser le cerveau non plus. La plupart sont basés sur le fait d'aligner des objets pour qu'une fois vus depuis le bon angle ils forment un symbole, ce qui colle bien avec le thème du jeu. Il y a bien d'autres mécanismes que je ne vais pas spoiler ici pour ne pas gâcher la découverte, mais ils sont tous basés sur la navigation dans l'environnement et sa manipulation. Là aussi c'est vite pris en main et plutôt satisfaisant.

Là où le jeu brille vraiment c'est sur la narration. On joue Senua, une jeune guerrière Picte qui est atteinte de psychose et trimballe un fameux lot de traumatismes qui se manifestent de toutes sortes de manières à commencer par les voix qui sont présentes dès le début du jeu. L'histoire est racontée façon "walking simualtor" au travers d'élements de l'environnement, de flashbacks, de souvenirs et pensées parmi les voix. C'est difficile de mettre le doigt sur un point précis qui fait le succès de la narration, mais quoi que Ninja Theory aient fait ils l'ont bien fait, on a droit à un personnage attachant et une histoire captivante. Peu de jeux m'ont provoqué une réaction émotionnelle aussi intense que Hellblade, c'est du bel ouvrage.

À jouer à la manette idéalement, et au casque pour bien profiter des indices sonores. Comptez six ou sept heures de jeu si vous n'êtes pas complétionniste.

183540197.review:
It's been on my wishlist for a while for some reason, and the current sale gave me no excuses to finally make the purchase. 
Even just getting through the intro is epic, with a new PC and every graphics setting maxed out my eyes dried up for fear of blinking.  Headphones are a must, the lack of HUD is super immersive, you are about as close to standing at Senua's side as you can get.  The lack of HUD makes interacting with the environment way more organic, there's no hand holding as you search for the rune in the first puzzle of the game, and the voices egging you on really add to the experience.
Usually in any other game with this kind of setting, you'd spend the first 40 minutes looking through the inventories of a half a dozen slain skeletons to find out which identical dagger does 1 more point of damage more than the one you are using. Not here, I couldn't even draw my sword for the first 30 minutes, and I wasn't chomping at the bit to start slashing at thin air during the initial journey either. This does a fantastic job of storytelling, and there's hasn't been a single second wasted on tutorial nonsense that takes you out of the universe and forces you to learn how to look around.  It's all build in and seamless.
If you're after a hack and slash RPG, this isn't the title you're going to want to pick up.  Don't get me wrong, I like my slasher RPGs too, but I'm also excited for a bit of a change.  This seems more like following the main character in an epic movie, and I'm sure it won't be long before the rights are bought up by Uwe Boll or Disney and one or the other will make a 90 minute vomit-inducing dumpster fire out of the source material.
